p: Taken together, results from the combination of molecular biology, biochemistry, and electrophysiology demonstrate that an increased number of missing glycosylation sites lead to a decrease in the surface appearance of the receptors (reflected by decreasing currents and the decreasing intensity of bands on the SDS-gel). A functional difference was only found for the constructs that were deficient of the third glycosylation site. These constructs showed the effect of decreased ATP sensitivity with an EC 50 value of 2 µM compared to the wild-type receptor with an EC 50 value of 0.6 µM.
